auto-generated SWIG bindings wrapping C++ ITK image filters.\n- The key functional component is `weighted_add_image_filter`, which creates and configures filter objects.\n- No network, file, or system command execution is present.\n- The code relies on external, well-established libraries (ITK).\n- No hardcoded secrets, obfuscation, or malicious patterns are evident.\n- The only potential concern is the call to `__internal_call__()` on filter objects, which depends on the underlying library's implementation.\n\n---\n\n### Review of each report:\n\n**Report 1:**\n- **Purpose:** Standard binding
